cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 185 (Wednesday, November 8, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. BACON:H.R. 6287.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:The constitutional authority of which this bill rests isthe power of Congress to make rules for the government andregulation of the land and naval forces, as enumerated inArticle 1, Section 8, Clause 14 of the United StatesConstitutionThe single subject of this legislation is:To extend the requirement to staff Department of DefenseEducation Activity schools to maintain maximum student-to-teacher ratios.[Page H5652]

item.title: Servicemember Quality of Life Improvement and National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2025
Servicemember Quality of Life Improvement and National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2025
Success for Military Connected Students Act of 2023

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.

item.text: Referred to the Committee on Armed Services, and in addition to the Committee on Education and the Workforce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on Armed Services, and in addition to the Committee on Education and the Workforce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

bill.title: Success for Military Connected Students Act of 2023

item.title: Success for Military Connected Students Act of 2023
Success for Military Connected Students Act of 2023
To extend the requirement to staff Department of Defense Education Activity schools to maintain maximum student-to-teacher ratios.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Armed Services, and in addition to the Committee on Education and the Workforce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
